title: Is there a good English translation of the Tao Te Ching? - Quora

response.answer_text: Others already gave some examples of translations, but I think you might want something to make you understand what the words mean/how they are meant. So I give you a book which ‘tries’ to explain Taoism, with some quotations of the Tao te ching and what is meant: Tao : The Watercourseway by Alan Watts - Wikipedia (click on tao for isbn and such) I recommend his books on Eastern philosophy in general and also his own philosophy books.

No translation can be compared unless you know the language in which it was written…how are you going to compare?…instead..read as many translations as possible…at least 4 or 5….go one by one…same verse in all the books you have…I read 7 translations of Tao teh ching by Lao Tzu …thus was my book “unparalled parallel born…published by partridge…please read it…your feed back will be appreciated…thanks
